WebSocket Consumer#

Overview#

The WebSocket consumer module provides functionality for handling WebSocket connections and managing real-time communication within the chat application.

WebSocket Consumer Code#

This section provides detailed documentation for the WebSocket consumer code.

class chat.consumers.ChatConsumer(*args, **kwargs)#

Bases: AsyncWebsocketConsumer

Handles WebSocket connections for the chat functionality.

This consumer manages WebSocket connections for the chat feature of the application. It performs authentication, authorization, and joins users to chat rooms.

async chat_message(event)#

Handles the ‘chat.message’ event.

Parameters:

event (dict) – A dictionary containing event data, including the message and action.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If essential keys are missing in the event data.

  • Exception – If an unexpected error occurs during event handling.

async chat_user_data(event)#

Handles the ‘chat.user_data’ event.

Parameters:

event (dict) – A dictionary containing event data, including user information and action.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If essential keys are missing in the event data.

  • Exception – If an unexpected error occurs during event handling.

async connect()#

Called when a WebSocket connection is established.

This method performs authentication, verifies the availability of the associated course, checks if the user is authorized to access the chat room, and joins the user to the appropriate chat room.

Raises:

WebSocketClose –

  • If the user is not authenticated, the WebSocket connection is closed with error code 4003 and the reason “Anonymous Users are not allowed”.

  • If the associated course is not found for the chat room, the WebSocket connection is closed with error code 4004 and the reason “Course not found for room”.

  • If the user is not authorized to access the chat room, the WebSocket connection is closed with error code 4001 and the reason “User not authorized”.

connected_users = {}#
async disconnect(close_code)#

Handles the disconnection of a WebSocket connection.

This method is called when a WebSocket connection is closed, and it performs cleanup tasks such as notifying other users about the disconnection, removing the user from the list of connected users, and leaving the room group.

Parameters:

close_code (int) – The code indicating the reason for the disconnection.

Raises:

WebSocketClose – If any error occurs during the disconnection process.

get_connected_users()#

Retrieves the list of connected users.

Returns:

A list of connected users.

Return type:

list

get_course_for_room()#

Retrieves the course associated with the chat room.

This method queries the database to find the course associated with the chat room.

Returns:

The course associated with the chat room, or None if the room doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Course or None

get_last_viewed_message(chat_room_id)#

Retrieves the ID of the last message viewed by the user in the specified chat room.

Parameters:

chat_room_id (int) – The ID of the chat room.

Returns:

The ID of the last viewed message, or None if no message is viewed.

Return type:

int or None

async handle_get_user_data(message_data)#

Handles the request to retrieve user data from the WebSocket connection.

This method processes the request to retrieve user data and sends the user data to the chat room group.

Parameters:

message_data (dict) – The message data received from the WebSocket connection.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during the retrieval or sending of user data.

async handle_last_viewed_message(message_data)#

Handles the request to updates the last viewed message ID before disconnecting.

Parameters:

message_data (dict) – The message data received from the WebSocket connection.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during the processing of the close user connection request.

is_user_authorized()#

Checks if the user is authorized to access the chat room.

This method checks whether the user associated with the WebSocket connection is authorized to access the chat room. A user is considered authorized if they are enrolled in the course associated with the chat room or if they are the teacher of the course.

Returns:

True if the user is authorized, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

async leave_room_group()#

Removes the WebSocket connection from the chat room group.

This method removes the WebSocket connection from the chat room group, allowing the user to leave the chat room.

Raises:

WebSocketClose – If any error occurs while leaving the room group.

async notify_user_disconnected()#

Notifies other users in the chat room about the disconnection of the current user.

This method sends a message to the chat room group indicating that a user has disconnected. The message includes information about the disconnected user.

Raises:

WebSocketClose – If any error occurs while sending the disconnection message.

async process_incoming_message(message_data)#

Processes the incoming message from the WebSocket connection.

This method processes the incoming message, saves it to the database, and broadcasts it to the chat room group.

Parameters:

message_data (dict) – The message data received from the WebSocket connection.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during message processing.

async process_message_data(message_data)#

Process incoming message data by adding user ID, retrieving related chat room and user instances, serializing the message data, validating it, and saving the validated message object to the database.

Parameters:

message_data (dict) – The incoming message data containing chat room, user, and message details.

Returns:

The cleaned and saved message object data.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the message data is invalid.

async receive(text_data)#

Receives and processes incoming messages from the WebSocket connection.

This method handles incoming messages received from the WebSocket connection. It parses the incoming message data, processes it accordingly, and takes appropriate actions based on the contents of the message.

Parameters:

text_data (str) – The message data received from the WebSocket connection.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during message processing.

remove_user_from_connected_users()#

Removes the disconnected user from the connected_users dictionary.

This method removes the user from the dictionary tracking connected users. It removes all occurrences of the room group name associated with the disconnected user.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If the disconnected user’s username is not found in the connected_users dictionary.

  • ValueError – If an error occurs while removing the user from the connected_users dictionary.

async send_user_data(users)#

Sends user data to the room group.

Parameters:

users (list) – List of connected users.

Raises:

Exception: If there is an error while sending user data to the room group.

update_last_viewed_message_id(chat_room_id, message_id)#

Updates the last viewed message ID for the user in the specified chat room.

Parameters:

  • chat_room_id (int) – The ID of the chat room.

  • message_id (int) – The ID of the last viewed message.

Returns:

True if the update is successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
